verses.kjv: Moreover, when ye shall divide by lot the land for inheritance, ye shall offer an oblation unto the LORD, an holy portion of the land: the length shall be the length of five and twenty thousand reeds, and the breadth shall be ten thousand. This shall be holy in all the borders thereof round about.
verses.web: “ ‘ “Moreover, when you divide by lot the land for inheritance, you shall offer an offering to LORD, a holy portion of the land. The length shall be the length of twenty-five thousand reeds, and the width shall be ten thousand. It shall be holy in all its border all around.
verses.ct: When you divide the land among the tribes by lot, you must set apart a portion as a sacred offering to the LORD — a holy section of land 25,000 reeds long and 10,000 reeds wide. This entire area will be holy within all its boundaries.

verses.kjv: Of this there shall be for the sanctuary five hundred in length, with five hundred in breadth, square round about; and fifty cubits round about for the suburbs thereof.
verses.web: Of this there shall be a five hundred by five hundred square for the holy place; and fifty cubits for its pasture lands all around.
verses.ct: Within this area, a square section 500 by 500 will be reserved for the sanctuary, with an open space of 50 cubits surrounding it on every side.

verses.kjv: And of this measure shalt thou measure the length of five and twenty thousand, and the breadth of ten thousand: and in it shall be the sanctuary and the most holy place.
verses.web: Of this measure you shall measure a length of twenty-five thousand, and a width of ten thousand. In it shall be the sanctuary, which is most holy.
verses.ct: From this holy district, measure out a section 25,000 long and 10,000 wide. The sanctuary — the most holy place — will be located within it.

verses.kjv: The holy portion of the land shall be for the priests the ministers of the sanctuary, which shall come near to minister unto the LORD: and it shall be a place for their houses, and an holy place for the sanctuary.
verses.web: It is a holy portion of the land; it shall be for the priests, the ministers of the sanctuary, who come near to minister to LORD. It shall be a place for their houses and a holy place for the sanctuary.
verses.ct: This holy portion of the land belongs to the priests who serve in the sanctuary and come near to minister before the LORD. It will provide space for their homes and be set apart as holy ground around the sanctuary.

verses.kjv: And the five and twenty thousand of length, and the ten thousand of breadth, shall also the Levites, the ministers of the house, have for themselves, for a possession for twenty chambers.
verses.web: Twenty-five thousand in length, and ten thousand in width, shall be for the Levites, the ministers of the house, as a possession for themselves, for twenty rooms.
verses.ct: Another section 25,000 long and 10,000 wide will belong to the Levites who serve in the temple. It will be their own territory, with 20 rooms for them to live in.

verses.kjv: And ye shall appoint the possession of the city five thousand broad, and five and twenty thousand long, over against the oblation of the holy portion: it shall be for the whole house of Israel.
verses.web: “ ‘ “You shall appoint the possession of the city five thousand wide, and twenty-five thousand long, side by side with the offering of the holy portion: it shall be for the whole house of Israel.
verses.ct: Next to the sacred district, set aside a strip of land 5,000 wide and 25,000 long as property for the city. This will belong to the whole house of Israel.

verses.kjv: And a portion shall be for the prince on the one side and on the other side of the oblation of the holy portion, and of the possession of the city, before the oblation of the holy portion, and before the possession of the city, from the west side westward, and from the east side eastward: and the length shall be over against one of the portions, from the west border unto the east border.
verses.web: “ ‘ “What is for the prince shall be on the one side and on the other side of the holy offering and of the possession of the city, in front of the holy offering and in front of the possession of the city, on the west side westward, and on the east side eastward; and in length answerable to one of the portions, from the west border to the east border.
verses.ct: The prince will receive land on both sides of the sacred district and the city property. His territory will stretch westward from the sacred district to the western border and eastward to the eastern border, matching the length of one of the tribal portions from west to east.

verses.kjv: In the land shall be his possession in Israel: and my princes shall no more oppress my people; and the rest of the land shall they give to the house of Israel according to their tribes.
verses.web: In the land it shall be to him for a possession in Israel. My princes shall no more oppress my people; but they shall give the land to the house of Israel according to their tribes.”
verses.ct: This land will be the prince's own property in Israel. My princes will never again oppress my people. Instead, they will let the rest of the land be distributed to the house of Israel according to their tribes.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the Lord GOD; Let it suffice you, O princes of Israel: remove violence and spoil, and execute judgment and justice, take away your exactions from my people, saith the Lord GOD.
verses.web: “ ‘The Lord LORD says: “Let it suffice you, princes of Israel: remove violence and plunder, and execute justice and righteousness; dispossessing my people,” says the Lord LORD.
verses.ct: The Lord GOD says: "Enough, princes of Israel! Stop your violence and plundering. Practice justice and do what is right. Stop evicting my people from their land," declares the Lord GOD.

verses.kjv: Ye shall have just balances, and a just ephah, and a just bath.
verses.web: “You shall have just balances, a just ephah, and a just bath.
verses.ct: "You must use honest scales, an honest ephah, and an honest bath.

verses.kjv: The ephah and the bath shall be of one measure, that the bath may contain the tenth part of an homer, and the ephah the tenth part of an homer: the measure thereof shall be after the homer.
verses.web: The ephah and the bath shall be of one measure, that the bath may contain one tenth of a homer, and the ephah one tenth of a homer. Its measure shall be the same as the homer.
verses.ct: The ephah and the bath must be the same standard size. Each one equals a 10th of a homer — the homer is the standard by which both are measured.

verses.kjv: And the shekel shall be twenty gerahs: twenty shekels, five and twenty shekels, fifteen shekels, shall be your maneh.
verses.web: The shekel shall be twenty gerahs. Twenty shekels plus twenty-five shekels plus fifteen shekels shall be your mina.
verses.ct: A shekel equals 20 gerahs. Your mina will be worth 60 shekels — that is, 20 plus 25 plus 15 shekels.

verses.kjv: This is the oblation that ye shall offer; the sixth part of an ephah of an homer of wheat, and ye shall give the sixth part of an ephah of an homer of barley:
verses.web: “ ‘ “This is the offering that you shall offer: the sixth part of an ephah from a homer of wheat; and you shall give the sixth part of an ephah from a homer of barley;
verses.ct: Here is the offering you must contribute: a 6th of an ephah from every homer of wheat, and a 6th of an ephah from every homer of barley.

verses.kjv: Concerning the ordinance of oil, the bath of oil, ye shall offer the tenth part of a bath out of the cor, which is an homer of ten baths; for ten baths are an homer:
verses.web: and the set portion of oil, of the bath of oil, one tenth of a bath out of the cor, which is ten baths, even a homer; (for ten baths are a homer;)
verses.ct: For oil, the required portion is a 10th of a bath from every cor (a cor equals a homer, which is 10 baths).

verses.kjv: And one lamb out of the flock, out of two hundred, out of the fat pastures of Israel; for a meat offering, and for a burnt offering, and for peace offerings, to make reconciliation for them, saith the Lord GOD.
verses.web: and one lamb of the flock, out of two hundred, from the well-watered pastures of Israel—for a meal offering, and for a burnt offering, and for peace offerings, to make atonement for them,” says the Lord LORD.
verses.ct: Also, 1 lamb from every flock of 200 from the well-watered pastures of Israel. These are for the grain offerings, burnt offerings, and peace offerings to make atonement for the people," says the Lord GOD.

verses.kjv: All the people of the land shall give this oblation for the prince in Israel.
verses.web: “All the people of the land shall give to this offering for the prince in Israel.
verses.ct: "All the people of the land must contribute this offering to the prince in Israel.

verses.kjv: And it shall be the prince’s part to give burnt offerings, and meat offerings, and drink offerings, in the feasts, and in the new moons, and in the sabbaths, in all solemnities of the house of Israel: he shall prepare the sin offering, and the meat offering, and the burnt offering, and the peace offerings, to make reconciliation for the house of Israel.
verses.web: It shall be the prince’s part to give the burnt offerings, the meal offerings, and the drink offerings, in the feasts, and on the new moons, and on the Sabbaths, in all the appointed feasts of the house of Israel. He shall prepare the sin offering, the meal offering, the burnt offering, and the peace offerings, to make atonement for the house of Israel.”
verses.ct: It will be the prince's responsibility to provide the burnt offerings, grain offerings, and drink offerings for the festivals, the new moon celebrations, the Sabbaths, and all the appointed feasts of the house of Israel. He will prepare the sin offering, the grain offering, the burnt offering, and the peace offerings to make atonement for the house of Israel."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the Lord GOD; In the first month, in the first day of the month, thou shalt take a young bullock without blemish, and cleanse the sanctuary:
verses.web: “ ‘The Lord LORD says: “In the first month, in the first day of the month, you shall take a young bull without defect; and you shall cleanse the sanctuary.
verses.ct: The Lord GOD says: "On the 1st day of the 1st month, you must take a young bull without any defect and purify the sanctuary.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall take of the blood of the sin offering, and put it upon the posts of the house, and upon the four corners of the settle of the altar, and upon the posts of the gate of the inner court.
verses.web: The priest shall take of the blood of the sin offering, and put it on the door posts of the house, and on the four corners of the ledge of the altar, and on the posts of the gate of the inner court.
verses.ct: The priest will take some of the blood from the sin offering and apply it to the doorposts of the temple, the 4 corners of the altar's ledge, and the gateposts of the inner court.

verses.kjv: And so thou shalt do the seventh day of the month for every one that erreth, and for him that is simple: so shall ye reconcile the house.
verses.web: So you shall do on the seventh day of the month for everyone who errs, and for him who is simple. So you shall make atonement for the house.
verses.ct: Do the same thing on the 7th day of the month for anyone who has sinned unintentionally or out of ignorance. In this way you will make atonement for the temple.

verses.kjv: In the first month, in the fourteenth day of the month, ye shall have the passover, a feast of seven days; unleavened bread shall be eaten.
verses.web: “ ‘ “In the first month, in the fourteenth day of the month, you shall have the Passover, a feast of seven days; unleavened bread shall be eaten.
verses.ct: On the 14th day of the 1st month, you will celebrate the Passover — a festival lasting 7 days during which only unleavened bread may be eaten.

verses.kjv: And upon that day shall the prince prepare for himself and for all the people of the land a bullock for a sin offering.
verses.web: On that day the prince shall prepare for himself and for all the people of the land a bull for a sin offering.
verses.ct: On that day, the prince will provide a bull as a sin offering for himself and for all the people of the land.

verses.kjv: And seven days of the feast he shall prepare a burnt offering to the LORD, seven bullocks and seven rams without blemish daily the seven days; and a kid of the goats daily for a sin offering.
verses.web: The seven days of the feast he shall prepare a burnt offering to LORD, seven bulls and seven rams without defect daily the seven days; and a male goat daily for a sin offering.
verses.ct: During each of the 7 days of the festival, he will provide a burnt offering to the LORD — 7 bulls and 7 rams without any defect each day, along with a male goat each day as a sin offering.

verses.kjv: And he shall prepare a meat offering of an ephah for a bullock, and an ephah for a ram, and an hin of oil for an ephah.
verses.web: He shall prepare a meal offering, an ephah for a bull, and an ephah for a ram, and a hin of oil to an ephah.
verses.ct: He will also provide a grain offering of 1 ephah for each bull and 1 ephah for each ram, along with a hin of oil for every ephah.

verses.kjv: In the seventh month, in the fifteenth day of the month, shall he do the like in the feast of the seven days, according to the sin offering, according to the burnt offering, and according to the meat offering, and according to the oil.
verses.web: “ ‘ “In the seventh month, in the fifteenth day of the month, in the feast, he shall do like that for seven days; according to the sin offering, according to the burnt offering, and according to the meal offering, and according to the oil.”
verses.ct: During the festival that begins on the 15th day of the 7th month, the prince must provide the same offerings for 7 days — the same sin offerings, burnt offerings, grain offerings, and oil."
